data.name: WindowsTaskScheduler_Description
data.value: Perform operations related to the Windows Task Scheduler.

data.name: CreateTask_Description
data.value: Creates a task with the specified name.

data.name: CreateTaskAction_Description
data.value: Creates an action in the task with the specified name.

data.name: CreateTaskTrigger_Description
data.value: Creates a trigger for the task with the specified name.

data.name: DeleteTask_Description
data.value: Deletes a task with the specified name.

data.name: DeleteTaskTrigger_Description
data.value: Deletes a trigger for the task with the specified name.

data.name: GetFolderTasks_Description
data.value: Gets the list of tasks in the specified folder.

data.name: GetTaskTriggers_Description
data.value: Gets the list of triggers for a task with the specified name.

data.name: Error_UnknownError_Description
data.value: Indicates that there was a problem when executing the operation.

data.name: Error_TaskNotFoundError_Description
data.value: Indicates that the task was not found.

data.name: Error_TaskTriggerNotFoundError_Description
data.value: Indicates that the trigger was not found.

data.name: Error_TaskTriggerUnknownError_Description
data.value: Indicates that there was a problem when executing the trigger operation.

data.name: SessionStateChangeType_ConsoleConnect_FriendlyName
data.value: On connected from user session from local computer

data.name: SessionStateChangeType_ConsoleConnect_Description
data.value: When connected to the user session from local computer.

data.name: SessionStateChangeType_ConsoleDisconnect_FriendlyName
data.value: On disconnected from user session from local computer

data.name: SessionStateChangeType_ConsoleDisconnect_Description
data.value: When disconnected from the user session from local computer.

data.name: SessionStateChangeType_RemoteConnect_FriendlyName
data.value: On connected from user session from remote computer

data.name: SessionStateChangeType_RemoteConnect_Description
data.value: When connected to the user session from remote computer.

data.name: SessionStateChangeType_RemoteDisconnect_FriendlyName
data.value: On disconnected from user session from remote computer

data.name: SessionStateChangeType_RemoteDisconnect_Description
data.value: When disconnected from the user session from remote computer.

data.name: TriggerType_Idle_Description
data.value: Triggered when the workstation goes idle.

data.name: TriggerType_MonthlyDayOfWeek_FriendlyName
data.value: On a monthly schedule by day of the week

data.name: TriggerType_MonthlyDayOfWeek_Description
data.value: Triggered on a monthly schedule by day of the week.

data.name: TriggerType_Registration_Description
data.value: Triggered when a task is created or modified.

data.name: TriggerType_SessionStateChange_Description
data.value: Triggered when the state of the session changes.

data.name: CreateTask_Password_Description
data.value: The password that is used to connect to the computer. If the username and password are not specified, then the current token is used.

data.name: CreateTask_TargetServer_Description
data.value: The name of the computer to connect to. If empty, then the connection will be to the local computer.

data.name: CreateTask_TaskName_Description
data.value: The name of the task. It can't begin or end with a space character. The '.' character can't be used to specify the current task folder and the '..' characters can't be used to specify the parent task folder in the path.

data.name: CreateTask_UserName_Description
data.value: The username that is used during the connection to the computer. If not specified, then the current token is used.

data.name: CreateTaskAction_Password_Description
data.value: The password that is used to connect to the computer. If the username and password are not specified, then the current token is used.

data.name: CreateTaskAction_TargetServer_Description
data.value: The name of the computer to connect to. If empty, then the connection will be to the local computer.

data.name: CreateTaskAction_TaskName_Description
data.value: The name of the task. It can't begin or end with a space character. The '.' character can't be used to specify the current task folder and the '..' characters can't be used to specify the parent task folder in the path.

data.name: CreateTaskAction_UserName_Description
data.value: The username that is used during the connection to the computer. If not specified, then the current token is used.

data.name: CreateTaskAction_Arguments_Description
data.value: The arguments associated with the command-line operation.

data.name: CreateTaskAction_Path_Description
data.value: The path to an executable file.

data.name: CreateTaskAction_WorkingDirectory_Description
data.value: The directory that contains either the executable file or the files that are used by the executable file.

data.name: CreateTaskTrigger_Password_Description
data.value: The password that is used to connect to the computer. If the username and password are not specified, then the current token is used.

data.name: CreateTaskTrigger_TargetServer_Description
data.value: The name of the computer to connect to. If empty, then the connection will be to the local computer.

data.name: CreateTaskTrigger_TaskName_Description
data.value: The name of the task. It can't begin or end with a space character. The '.' character can't be used to specify the current task folder and the '..' characters can't be used to specify the parent task folder in the path.

data.name: CreateTaskTrigger_UserName_Description
data.value: The username that is used during the connection to the computer. If not specified, then the current token is used.

data.name: CreateTaskTrigger_Delay_Description
data.value: The amount of time between when the trigger is fired and when the task is executed.

data.name: CreateTaskTrigger_RepetitionDuration_Description
data.value: The duration that the pattern is repeated. The minimum time allowed is one minute. If zero is specified, the pattern is repeated indefinitely.

data.name: CreateTaskTrigger_EndBoundary_Description
data.value: The date and time when the trigger is deactivated. The trigger can't start the task after it is deactivated.

data.name: CreateTaskTrigger_StartBoundary_Description
data.value: The date and time when the trigger is activated.

data.name: CreateTaskTrigger_Timeout_Description
data.value: The maximum amount of time that the task launched by this trigger is allowed to run.

data.name: CreateTaskTrigger_RepetitionInterval_Description
data.value: The amount of time in days between each restart of the task. The value must be between 1 minute and 31 days.

data.name: CreateTaskTrigger_RandomDelay_Description
data.value: The delay time that is randomly added to the start time of the trigger.

data.name: CreateTaskTrigger_RunOnLastDayOfMonth_FriendlyName
data.value: Run On Last Day Of Month

data.name: CreateTaskTrigger_RunOnLastDayOfMonth_Description
data.value: Whether the task runs on the last day of the month.

data.name: CreateTaskTrigger_State_Description
data.value: The kind of Terminal Server session change that will trigger the task launch.

data.name: CreateTaskTrigger_RepetitionStopAtDurationEnd_FriendlyName
data.value: Stop At End of Repetition Duration

data.name: CreateTaskTrigger_RepetitionStopAtDurationEnd_Description
data.value: Whether a running instance of the task is stopped at the end of repetition pattern duration.

data.name: CreateTaskTrigger_Subscription_Description
data.value: The XPath query string that identifies the event that fires the trigger.

data.name: CreateTaskTrigger_UserId_Description
data.value: The identifier of the user. For example, "MyDomain\MyName" or for a local account, "Administrator".

data.name: CreateTaskTrigger_ValueQueries_Description
data.value: The collection of named XPath queries. Each query in the collection is applied to the last matching event XML returned from the subscription query.

data.name: DeleteTask_Password_Description
data.value: The password that is used to connect to the computer. If the username and password are not specified, then the current token is used.

data.name: DeleteTask_TargetServer_Description
data.value: The name of the computer to connect to. If empty, then the connection will be to the local computer.

data.name: DeleteTask_TaskName_Description
data.value: The name of the task. It can't begin or end with a space character. The '.' character can't be used to specify the current task folder and the '..' characters can't be used to specify the parent task folder in the path.

data.name: DeleteTask_UserName_Description
data.value: The username that is used during the connection to the computer. If not specified, then the current token is used.

data.name: DeleteTaskTrigger_Password_Description
data.value: The password that is used to connect to the computer. If the username and password are not specified, then the current token is used.

data.name: DeleteTaskTrigger_TargetServer_Description
data.value: The name of the computer to connect to. If empty, then the connection will be to the local computer.

data.name: DeleteTaskTrigger_TaskName_Description
data.value: The name of the task. It can't begin or end with a space character. The '.' character can't be used to specify the current task folder and the '..' characters can't be used to specify the parent task folder in the path.

data.name: DeleteTaskTrigger_UserName_Description
data.value: The username that is used during the connection to the computer. If not specified, then the current token is used.

data.name: GetFolderTasks_Password_Description
data.value: The password that is used to connect to the computer. If the username and password are not specified, then the current token is used.

data.name: GetFolderTasks_TargetServer_Description
data.value: The name of the computer to connect to. If empty, then the connection will be to the local computer.

data.name: GetFolderTasks_UserName_Description
data.value: The username that is used during the connection to the computer. If not specified, then the current token is used.

data.name: GetFolderTasks_Filter_Description
data.value: The regular expression to use as name filter.

data.name: GetFolderTasks_FolderPath_Description
data.value: The path to the folder containing the tasks.

data.name: GetFolderTasks_TaskNames_Description
data.value: The names of the tasks in the folder.

data.name: GetTaskTriggers_Password_Description
data.value: The password that is used to connect to the computer. If the username and password are not specified, then the current token is used.

data.name: GetTaskTriggers_TargetServer_Description
data.value: The name of the computer to connect to. If empty, then the connection will be to the local computer.

data.name: GetTaskTriggers_TaskName_Description
data.value: The name of the task. It can't begin or end with a space character. The '.' character can't be used to specify the current task folder and the '..' characters can't be used to specify the parent task folder in the path.

data.name: GetTaskTriggers_UserName_Description
data.value: The username that is used during the connection to the computer. If not specified, then the current token is used.

data.name: GetTaskTriggers_TriggerIds_Description
data.value: The identifiers of the triggers for the task.

data.name: Boot_Summary
data.value: Create a trigger to execute a task at startup.

data.name: Daily_Summary
data.value: Create a trigger to execute a task on a daily schedule.

data.name: Idle_Summary
data.value: Create a trigger to execute a task on idle.

data.name: Logon_Summary
data.value: Create a trigger to execute a task at log on.

data.name: Monthly_Summary
data.value: Create a trigger to execute a task on a monthly schedule.

data.name: MonthlyDayOfWeek_Summary
data.value: Create a trigger to execute a task on a monthly schedule at a day of the week.

data.name: Time_Summary
data.value: Create a trigger to execute a task one time.

data.name: Weekly_Summary
data.value: Create a trigger to execute a task on a weekly schedule.

data.name: Event_Summary
data.value: Create a trigger to execute a task on an event.

data.name: Registration_Summary
data.value: Create a trigger to execute a task at task creation/modification.

data.name: SessionStateChange_Summary
data.value: Create a trigger to execute a task on session state change.
